3. City Council

City Council
============

![7U2A6924](https://www.fatetx.gov/ImageRepository/Document?documentID=4886 "7U2A6924")

|  |
| --- |
| City Council Meetings |
| The Fate City Council meets at 6pm at Fate City Hall:  1900 CD Boren Pkwy Fate, TX. 75087  The City Council generally meets on the 1st and 3rd Monday of each month, unless otherwise noted as a "Special Meeting" .Citizen Comments:  * Citizens can provide comments to the City Council in person at Council Meetings. Click here to view the [Public Meeting Procedures/Rules of Procedure for Public Comment at Open Meetings.](https://www.fatetx.gov/DocumentCenter/View/3875/Public-Meeting-Procedures) * Send your comments online. Comments submitted online will be delivered to the Council but will not be included in the meeting record. Click here to [send your comments online](https://fatetx.form.transform.civicplus.com/54808).  Proclamations  * Click here to view the [Proclamation Policy](https://www.fatetx.gov/DocumentCenter/View/4315/Proclamation-Policy_24). |

|  |  |  |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Members and Terms | | |
| Member | Position | Term Expires |
| [Andrew Greenberg](https://www.fatetx.gov/Directory.aspx?EID=22) | Mayor | May 2028 |
| [Codi Chinn](https://www.fatetx.gov/directory.aspx?EID=21) | Council Member, Place 1 | May 2027 |
| [Mark Harper](https://www.fatetx.gov/directory.aspx?EID=18) | Council Member, Place 2 | May 2026 |
| [Scott Kelley](https://www.fatetx.gov/directory.aspx?EID=37) | Mayor Pro Tem, Council Member, Place 3 | May 2026 |
| [Rick Maneval](https://www.fatetx.gov/Directory.aspx?EID=45) | Council Member, Place 4 | May 2028 |
| [Mark Hatley](https://www.fatetx.gov/directory.aspx?EID=19) | Deputy Mayor Pro Tem, Council Member, Place 5 | May 2027 |
| [Martha Huffman](https://www.fatetx.gov/Directory.aspx?EID=46) | Council Member, Place 6 | May 2028 |

The Mayor and each member of the Council shall hold office for a three (3) year term. No person shall be elected to serve in the capacity of Council Member for more than two (2) consecutive three-year terms, nor shall any person be elected to serve in the capacity of Mayor for more than two (2) consecutive three-year terms.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

|  |
| --- |
| Agendas and Minutes |
| Agendas are available prior to the meetings. Minutes are available following approval.  [View Most Recent Agendas and Minutes](https://www.fatetx.gov/AgendaCenter/City-Council-2) |

|  |
| --- |
| Government |
| The City Council, elected by the community, serves as the official governing body. In 2008, voters approved a home rule charter, establishing a Council/Manager form of government.  This system combines the political leadership of elected council members with the managerial expertise of an appointed local government manager. The council holds all governing power and hires a professional manager to oversee public services. |

|  |
| --- |
| Elections |
| City Council members are elected for three-year terms on a nonpartisan basis. The Council consists of a Mayor and six Council members, all elected by the entire city. After elections, Council members select the Mayor Pro Tem and Deputy Mayor Pro Tem from among themselves. For more information about current elections, please visit the [elections webpage](https://www.fatetx.gov/435/Elections). |

|  |
| --- |
| Responsibilities |
| Council members hire the City Manager, appoint the City Secretary, Municipal Court Judges, and citizens to boards and commissions. They pass ordinances, plan capital improvements, issue and sell bonds, manage property transactions, establish departments, determine services, approve the budget, and set the tax rate. The City Manager oversees daily operations, hires department heads, supervises personnel, coordinates programs, enforces laws and ordinances, and recommends the annual budget. |

6. Friday: 8:00am to 12:00pm

/QuickLinks.aspx

1. City Tax Rate:
   ==============

   THE CITY OF FATE ADOPTED A TAX RATE THAT WILL RAISE MORE TAXES FOR MAINTENANCE AND OPERATIONS THAN LAST YEAR’S TAX RATE. THE TAX RATE WILL EFFECTIVELY BE RAISED BY 3.4 PERCENT AND WILL RAISE TAXES FOR MAINTENANCE AND OPERATIONS ON A $100,000 HOME BY APPROXIMATELY $6.61.
